question: In HTML5, which tag or tags embed a webpage inside of a webpage?
What is the best way to apply bold styling to text?

answer.choice1: when linking style sheets, JavaScript, and icons for mobile apps
answer.choice2: when linking style sheets, favicons, and preloading assets
answer.choice3: when linking style sheets and favicons
answer.choice4: when linking style sheets, external URLs, and favicons

question: With which tags is the `<source>` element associated?

answer.choice3: It is interchangeable with the `src` attribute, so any element which uses `src` may use `<source>`

question: When should you use `<ol>` and `<ul>` elements?

answer.choice1: Use `<ul>` when you want a bulleted list and `<ol>` when you want a numbered list.
answer.choice2: Use `<ul>` when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use `<ol>` when you have a list of items that could go in any order.
answer.choice3: Use `<ol>` when you want a bulleted list and `<ul>` when you want a numbered list.
answer.choice4: Use `<ol>` when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use `<ul>` when you have a list of items that could go in any order.

question: What is the difference between the post and get methods in a form?

answer.choice1: post is used for sending information to the server. get is used for retrieving form information from the server.
answer.choice2: get is used for sending information to the server. post is used for retrieving form information from the server.
answer.choice3: With get, data is included in the form body when send to the server. With post, the data goes through the URL.
answer.choice4: With post, data is included in the form body when send to the server. With get, the data goes through the URL.

question: What is the difference between the `<div>` and `<span>` tags?

answer.choice1: `<div>` is used where a generic block-level tag is needed, while `<span>` is used where a generic inline tag is needed.
answer.choice2: `<div>` is used for major divisions on a page, while `<span>` is used to span across columns.
answer.choice3: `<div>` is the industry-standard default tag, but you could use `<span>` if you prefer.
answer.choice4: `<div>` is used where a generic inline tag is needed, while `<span>` is used where a generic block-level tag is needed.

question: What is the difference between the `<head>` and `<header>` tags in HTML?

answer.choice1: There is only one `<head>` tag per page, while there may be many `<header>` tags.
answer.choice2: The `<head>` tag may contain CSS and Javascript links, while the `<header>` tag may contain headings and navigational links.
answer.choice4: The `<head>` tag contains meta information, while the `<header>` tag contains navigation, logos, and other page identifying content.

answer.choice1: It labels webpages with important information.
answer.choice2: It visually associates a text label with an interface element.
answer.choice4: It programmatically associates a text label with an interface element.

question: Which statement is true about the defer attribute of the HTML script tag?

answer.choice1: The defer attribute can work synchronously.
answer.choice2: The defer attribute works only with generators.
answer.choice3: The defer attribute works only with promises.
answer.choice4: The defer attribute will asynchronously load the scripts in order.

question: Which tag is the root element of an HTML document?
What is the purpose of the async keyword in a script tag?

answer.choice1: It will download the script from the server when resources allow.
answer.choice2: It will run the script after HTML parsing is complete.
answer.choice3: It makes the script run when the script is ready.
answer.choice4: It pauses the parsing of HTML code while the script runs.
